Package com.intellij.util.ui.accessibility

Class ScreenReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.util.ui.accessibility.ScreenReader

  • public class ScreenReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Expose system-wide screen reader status for accessibility features.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public static boolean isActive()
        Components that need to customize their behavior in the presence of an external screen reader application should call this method. For example, this can be used to determine if components should to be focusable via keyboard -- as opposed to accessible only via the mouse pointer.

      • setActive

        public static void setActive(boolean active)
        This method should be called by a central configuration mechanism to enable screen reader support for the application.

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled(java.lang.String a11yClassName)
        Checks whether a particular a11y technology is enabled, in order of priority: 1) via the sys. property: "javax.accessibility.assistive_technologies" 2) in the prop. file: /.accessibility.properties 3) in the prop. file: /lib/accessibility.properties
        Parameters:
        a11yClassName - the full class name representing the a11y technology
        Returns:
        true if enabled, otherwise false
        See Also:
        ACCESS_BRIDGE, ATK_WRAPPER

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public static void addPropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                             Disposable parent,
                                             java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Adds property change listener. Supported properties: SCREEN_READER_ACTIVE_PROPERTY
